```python
#!/usr/bin/python3

from sys import argv
from subprocess import call

command_half = ' '.join(argv[1:])

while True:
        command = input(command_half + '> ')
        if command == ':q':
                print("Bye!")
                break
        call(argv[1:] + command.split())
```
it's really short
and you can use options and whatnot
the `echo` gets automatically prepended to it

it basically lets you do this:
```sh
$ with echo
echo> foo
foo
echo> bar
bar
```

I also used Eclipse ( actually myEclipse ) for quite a while but gave up on it, its very powerful but cumbersome.  WebStorm and RubyMine are much more light weight and focused on web development.
